messages.title: Can Paul win?
messages.content:
The last time Paul Sample stood for Parliament, in 1992, he took more than any Liberal Democrat candidate in Salisbury's recorded history!
12,375 people voted for Paul Sample last time he stood.
In 2015 the Conservative candidate took 28,192. Lots of people are saying they would vote for Paul if they thought he could be the sitting MP.
Yes he can!
Next time you see Paul on the election trail give him a wave!
This time Paul! Elect an MP who puts Salisbury & South Wiltshire first.

messages.title: How you can find out more…
messages.content:
Twitter: @PaulSample2010
Facebook: @PaulSampleLibDem
Website: www.paulsample.co.uk
Phone: 077 1818 5039
Email: paulsample173@icloud.com

messages.title: 3 good reasons to elect Paul...
messages.content:
1. Paul Sample is a Wiltshire man, born and bred. His family came to live in Salisbury in 1974. He was educated at Bishop Wordsworth's School. Paul and Catherine Sample have brought up children and lived for many years in Salisbury. He is a local man with local roots!
2. Paul Sample was a local Councillor from 1990 until 2013. He was Mayor of Salisbury in 1991-1992 and raised £6,500 to provide respite breaks for families with disabilities and their carers. Everyone knows someone who has been helped by Paul!
3. Paul is the MD of a successful marketing agency in Wilton. He was the first Group Leader of Salisbury District Council. The role was abolished in 2009. He last stood for Parliament in 1992. He has experience you can rely on.

messages.title: Liberal Democrats demand £4.6bn to fix NHS funding
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats have demanded an extra £4.6bn for the crumbling NHS. They have called for a dedicated NHS and Social Care Tax to help reduce the growing crisis in the NHS. Paul Sample has worked hard to campaign for proper funding of NHS staff.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Liberal Democrats demand an extra £4.6bn for the NHS and propose a dedicated NHS and Social Care Tax.
